name: The Mayor of Casterbridge by Thomas Hardy Quiz | Literature | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Michael Henchard--twice.

	Susan and Michael marry for the first time when they are about 18. Susan lives with Newson and bears his child, but she never marries him. Then she marries Henchard again when the two are middle-aged.

Susan Henchard and Mr. Newson

	The first little Elizabeth Jane, Michael's daughter, dies after Susan goes off with Mr. Newson. When Susan and Newson have their own little daughter, Susan names this child Elizabeth Jane, as well.

questions.text: Why does Susan go off with Mr. Newson?
questions.correct: Her husband sells her to Newson
options: Susan is in love with Mr. Newson
Susan is pregnant with Newson's baby
Her sailor husband, Henchard, is lost at sea
questions.explanation:
Her husband sells her to Newson.

	Michael Henchard gets drunk at a country fair and offers his wife for sale to whoever will offer him five pounds. Mr. Newson happens to come along and offer this sum. Susan, who is fed up (and naive enough to think her husband may lawfully sell her), goes with the man who has "bought" her. Luckily, he turns out to be very kind.

questions.text: Why do Susan and Elizabeth Jane first come to Casterbridge?
questions.correct: They are searching for Michael Henchard
options: A local landlord has offered them jobs at his inn
They are searching for Mr. Newson
They are searching for Mr. Farfrae
questions.explanation:
They are searching for Michael Henchard.

	After Mr. Newson is lost at sea, Susan decides to search for her lawful husband, even though he treated her so poorly long ago. She and her daughter have very little money, and Susan hopes that Henchard can help to support them.

questions.text: What does Michael Henchard vow to do for twenty years?
options: employ Donald Farfrae as his manager
study books in order to become more refined
questions.explanation:
refrain from drinking alcohol.

	Henchard believes that strong drink led him to wrong his wife and child.

Mr. Farfrae

	Before Henchard's wife returns, Lucetta falls in love with him while nursing the man through an illness. Henchard breaks his engagement to Lucetta after Susan reappears. After Susan's death, Lucetta happens to meet and fall for Farfrae when she moves to Casterbridge in hopes of finally getting Henchard to marry her.

pretty, highly-strung, loving.

	Lucetta takes Elizabeth Jane's beau, but the older woman does not know that Elizabeth loves Farfrae. Lucetta deeply loves Donald and will do anything to keep him from finding out that she had a bad reputation in her former home, Jersey. After the skimmington reveals Lucetta's former connection with Henchard, the woman dies of shock (plus, she is pregnant).

questions.text: Which description best portrays Elizabeth Jane?
questions.explanation:
pretty, long-suffering, smart.

	She does not get her just reward until the very end of the novel: finally, Donald marries her as he had meant to do before Lucetta appeared on the scene. At first I liked Elizabeth far better than Lucetta, but by the end of the book I was not so sure: E. is just a little too much of a martyr and a goody two shoes (like Fanny Price in "Mansfield Park").

questions.text: Which description best portrays Michael Henchard?
questions.correct: He is deeply flawed but the reader feels sorry for him
options: He is generally cheerful and kind, but not very intelligent
He is a better-than-average husband and father
He is a thorough villain with no redeeming qualities at all
questions.explanation:
He is deeply flawed but the reader feels sorry for him.

	Henchard keeps making grave errors due to his impulsiveness, his hot temper, his distrust of others, and his addiction to drink. However, he often repents of his misdeeds and tries very hard to make up for them. Penniless and friendless, he dies a sad death. The novel is a typical Hardy-esque tragedy.

questions.correct: that no one should mourn for or remember him
options: It gives instructions for a simple pauper's funeral
that Elizabeth Jane is his biological daughter
It explains the whole saga of Susan, Lucetta, and himself
questions.explanation:
that no one should mourn for or remember him.

	His will is all about what NOT to do for him after he dies. The short document ends: "...and that no man remember me. To this I put my name. MICHAEL HENCHARD."
